definition: to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed

sentences.english: Iceland was able to secure an emergency loan from Russia.
sentences.chinese: 最後賴於俄國的緊急貸款，冰島免於罹難。

sentences.english: And we also had the privilege of meeting with some of their families, as well as some of the courageous survivors.
sentences.chinese: 我們還有幸會見了部分罹難者家屬和無畏的倖存者。

sentences.english: He escaped being killed in the blast because he had not gone to work.
sentences.chinese: 他因未去上工才避免在那次爆炸中罹難。

sentences.english: On the occasion of the Ming and Qing dynasty change, the family suffered heavy losses, many people died.
sentences.chinese: 明清鼎革之際，家族遭受重創，多人罹難。

sentences.english: No victim of the shipwreck has been found.
sentences.chinese: 海難的罹難者一個都沒找到。

sentences.english: The majority of the victims were aged 15-16.
sentences.chinese: 大部分的罹難者年齡在15到16歲不等。

sentences.english: China as a victim of WWII, sacrificed millions of ppl in war.
sentences.chinese: 中國是二戰的受害國，幾千萬人在戰爭中不幸罹難。

sentences.english: In the last war as many noncombatants as combatants were killed.
sentences.chinese: 上次戰爭中，戰鬥員與非戰鬥員罹難的數目相等。

definition: to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
to die in the line of duty
(of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
to be wounded/to sustain an injury
to inflict heavy losses/to inflict serious damage
